newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah stable in dull late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah stable in dull late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was stable against the dollar in slow late trading on Friday after a lack of fresh leads in the market and amid ample liquidity, dealers said.
They said liquidity was ample but operators were reluctant to boost dollar holdings because of liquidity worries due to the approaching fiscal year-end on March 31.
One local bank dealer said operators restrained themselves from buying dollars because liquidity could turn tight quickly.
Spot rupiah was at 2,388.25/88.50 at 0900 GMT against an opening of 2,388.25/89.00. Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,399.10/88.35 and 2,387.5/88.0, respectively.
"It's a one way market due to ample liquidity. Overall volume was thin," another dealer said.
Overnight swaps were at 0.3/0.4 and tom/next at 0.15/0.20.
One-month swaps were at 10.60/11.25, two at 24.0/25.0, three at 38.25/38.75 and six at 76.00/77.00 points.
Bank Indonesia kept its intervention band at 2,380/2,572 and the conversion band at 2,380/2,428 on Friday.
The central bank depreciated the rupiah by two points this week after lowering it by three points last week.
